channel.title: Business
channel.description: The latest business news, analysis and columns, including on the economy, personal finance, work, technology and more.

item.title: Trump’s shutdown plans: Mass layoffs, deregulation, military deployments
item.dc:creator: Jacob Bogage
item.description: The White House’s call for mass layoffs in a looming shutdown tracks with past administration efforts to defang much of the federal government.

item.title: NPR challenges CPB’s authority to redirect millions in funding
item.dc:creator: Scott Nover
item.description: The public radio network asked a federal judge to block the Corporation for Public Broadcasting from transferring $57.9 million to a new nonprofit.

item.title: Trump’s fresh tariffs could inflate consumer prices in months to come
item.dc:creator: Andrew Ackerman, Rachel Lerman
item.description: President Donald Trump has announced new sector-specific tariffs on pharmaceuticals, furniture, and other goods, which could exacerbate inflation.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel is coming back to Nexstar and Sinclair’s ABC stations
item.dc:creator: Scott Nover, Shannon Najmabadi
item.description: “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” has been off the air on ABC stations in D.C. and other markets since Disney-owned ABC reinstated the late-night host Tuesday.

item.title: The wealthiest are boosting the economy, as consumer spending rises again
item.dc:creator: Abha Bhattarai
item.description: Wealthy Americans are driving the U.S. economy with increased consumer spending and income growth

item.title: What Trump’s new tariffs mean for pharmaceuticals and patented drugs
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho, Victoria Craw, Daniel Gilbert
item.description: Trump said branded pharmaceutical products would face 100 percent tariffs unless certain exemptions applied, sparking some confusion over how the policy would be implemented.

item.title: Democrats say Bill Pulte ‘abused’ his role with mortgage fraud probes
item.dc:creator: Rachel Siegel
item.description: Six leading lawmakers said Pulte mounted a “politically motivated public campaign” against Trump’s enemies. They are seeking information on how peoples’ mortgage data is being used.

item.title: Trump announces new tariffs on trucks, furniture and pharmaceuticals
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Victoria Craw
item.description: Pharmaceuticals may face tariffs of up to 100 percent, kitchen cabinets 50 percent, upholstered furniture 30 percent and heavy trucks 25 percent from Oct. 1.

item.title: What to do if a federal government shutdown freezes your paycheck
item.dc:creator: Michelle Singletary
item.description: It’s not just federal workers who would take a hit, but contractors and the businesses that depend on them.

item.title: AI is taking on live translations. But jobs and meaning are getting lost.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Abril
item.description: New artificial intelligence-driven capabilities are expected to accelerate the shift from translation done by humans to machines.
